intro: Calophanes persoonii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of small, brightly colored blooms in shades of pink, purple, and white. It thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Calophanes persoonii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
